name: The Way of Life Free Edition
description: The Way of Life makes the player relive the same life's experiences from the point of view of three characters of different ages: an adult, an old man and a child.
minimum_requirements: OS: Windows Vista Processor: Intel Dual-Core 2.6 GHz / AMD Dual-Core Athlon 3.0 GHz Memory: 2 GB RAM Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce 8500 GT / AMD Radeon HD 4650 or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space
recommended_requirements: OS: Windows 7 or higher Processor: Quad-Core Processor Graphics: NVIDIA GeForce GTX 280 / AMD Radeon HD 4830 or greater DirectX: Version 11 Storage: 2 GB available space

reviews.review_text: This is a walking simulator. In this game you can pick what you want to happen in 3 different settings. A dream, a nightmare and the real world.  What will you choose, The grapichs are simplistics but still nice looking. You can be an adult, kid or old person. This is in first person view and and you feel the difference when controlling the different characters. There are multiple endings and alot of things too look at. The hole game is not unlocked since this is free so it is more like a demo of it. If a game that makes you think is for you then Enjoy keep going and have fun :)

Best Old Guy Simulator Ever!   Seriously though, it\'s not really a game but rather an artistic experience. Unfortunately I think I saw everything the free version had to offer in just a few minutes, but it was definitely unique and interesting.

Better than before, frame rate is better and i do recommend the game, can't wait for the definitive edition to come out, will ask youtubers to play this, I played it and recorded it about 7-8 months ago and really liked but now it seems as if it has been vastly improved the 2.0 update fixed quite a lot while keeping the same prospects of the early development of the game, hope it only gets better from here now!!! thanks daven8989 for responding as well really means that you care for the fans and the game itself!! also I didn't realize you would respond so i gave it a really bad critique if I saw you commenting to others then i wouldn't of said crap. But anyways really good i recommend it massively now thanks to the 2.0 update!
Great game played an hour really fun and sort of addicting!

Although this is a small game and doesn't take very long to 'beat' (hence why I have such a low play time) I Think that this game can teach all of us a leason about life whether it be something as simple as sharing or that a family brings happiness. Even though these are small life lessons this game puts a person in to the dilemma of having to deal with some situations that some people/families have had to deal with in the past.This game also teaches a person about oneself and can even make a person think about oneself for example if a person is internally making the right choices in life or ones that may only be hurting their life.   Verdict: I liked the game even if it was a short one I really loved the design and message that it can and should give to a person. I would definitly reccomend to atleast try it it is about a 10 minute download (probably shorter) and worth the 30 minutes to an hour gameplay.

This game has many grammatical errors, but the message still is portrayed to its audience. One thing that I wish was done better is the narration. It is just TOLD to you leaving no interpreting for the player, which gets on my nerves since it does this you have no way to elaborate and make bridges between the situation presented in the game and ones in real life. However, if you have trouble with finding the goods in life and how to escape situations this game presents a wonderful atmosphere for it.

Fun game overall and I actually enjoyed the story, sound, design, and mostly everything! Whoa! Great job, team! Surprised me that this game would actually have a meaningful story as well as entertaining gameplay AND be free. Even with limited graphics this game actually kept me engaged and taking screenshots due to the art design. This game took maybe an hour to beat and was well-worth the time! Would recommend for people whom enjoy short games that are still engaging.
its peacful scenic and touching
Slow, clunky, buggy, boring. Good art direction doesn't make a good game. I played 4 of the levels and didn't really enjoy any of them.

I couldn't get past the tutorial, there was a jump/run thing and I can't hit jump while running and if I stop I am not going fast enough. Obviously other people have made it past this point - though at least one other person had this problem. I am guessing it is a bug?  This does not appear to be the sort of game where there is any need for a hurdle like this.  On top of that I couldn't even quit the game, I had to taskmaster my way out of the tutorial. I really hate it when designers don't bother to give you a way to exit.

I liked what this game was trying to achieve, but the spelling mistakes made it funny instead of emotional, and some of the scenes made absolutely no sense, even if I thought about what they might mean in a metaphorical sense...

Kids are hyper and imaginative, adults are boring, and old people are slow. This developers next game will be about water being wet.  I played the original release of the game, which took about 20 minutes, and I began to get bored at around 15 minutes. But it had a cool concept so I was excited to see it fleshed out more. This new version was ok, but the developers tried adding bunch of unnessesary crap, and about 5 minutes in I was already bored. Then the game glitched and I got stuck in a wall, after killing my parents? I think?
(Error): You Need The Definative Edition To Play More Than 3 Levels

I tried this game for about 20 minutes, and in that time experienced more than enough to write this review. Right off the bat, one of the first things you will notice, is that the english in this game is pretty bad. While this is easily over-looked, it is still very annoying when setting the room. Now to describe the game itself!  This game uses a hub setting where all the levels are set in different rooms, each of which gives you several different scenarios. After entering the room you can choose whether to experience it as a child, adult, or senior citizen. This dynamic in itself is very focused on plot, but is used in a game which... has no plot? A questionable choice, but not a deal breaker. The real deal breaker is what happens after: Nothing! Let me explain. After choosing the scenario you will be teleported to the area you chose, as the character you chose. From there you can walk around and experience the situation. Often times it is pretty bland and lacking, and the couple of sentences used to describe it into a sensible situation are poorly written.   At this point it probably seems like a game with a poor setting, and their are tons of enjoyable games like that, but that isn't the bad part. The main thing that ruins this game is that it's pointless. After entering the scenario you walk, or fly, or whatever it asks. It feels very boring and unrewarding, and after doing it for about 2 or 3 minutes you hit a dead end. And that's it. There is nothing beyond that. All you can do is return to the hub from the main menu, and try a different scenario.  The gameplay consists entirely of walking, but unlike slender-man and other great walking games, there is no point to this one. The entire game is designed around a poorly written, meaningless story, that can't really even be called a story.  On top of everything it is extremely buggy as well, just FYI  So you have a game that: -Doesn't play well -Is glitchy -Poorly designed -Confuses the player with lack of instruction -Is POINTLESS and MEANINGLESS  Now I'm not trying to hate on the game itself or its creator, I'm just stating facts. Assuming this was made by a single developer, or maybe a small group of rookies, it's actually a pretty good attempt. However, you can't just turn anything into a game. You need to put some forethought into it. Checking you writing is also very important, and this game clearly didn't go through any of the essential checkpoints of game design. Avoid if at all possible.   UNDER NO CIRCUMSTANCE BUY THE PAID VERSION!!! I can only imagine how disappointed I would be if I had paid for this.

This game is actually so boring. Yes I get that it's free, and I get that it's meant to be a story driven game. But it is just not worth the space on your hard drive. I was bored in the first 3 minutes.  OVERVIEW:  Starts off with painfully dull tutorial.  You then proceed to the 'Door Room'  Choose a story  Get very, very bored  Repeat  BORING as all hell.  3/10  ~ IGN

The Way Of Life but until now im wondering what is this game about ?

This game is actually so bad it's funny. But I still wouldn't recommend it.    The grammer is TERRIBLE. I assume these are non native english speakers, but at least put it into word or something to profread.  The game is buggy and I got stuck multiple times.  The game doesn't run at 60fps at 1440p at ultra despite me running a GTX 980.  The stories are transparent and very straightfoward, lacking any hint of nuance.  I do believe that games can be art, but I don't believe this game has artistic value.

Whatever you do, don't waste your time in trying to complete this game or better yet, don't play this game. It is such a bother to play through each scenario and in the end, you just don't really care about the core message that the game is trying to convey. Although this is free, it is not worth it even for casual gamers, you will find yourself completely bored in the first five minutes. It had potential, and it could of been tremendously good, but it went all down the drown through poor writing, sluggish controls and brain dead gameplay. DON'T WASTE YOUR BELOVED TIME ON THIS RUBBISH.
Pretty underwhelming- lots of grammatical and spelling errors, not clear instructions on how to play, unengaging plot.

If you liked 'Dear Esther', you might enjoy this game. I disliked that one, and I dislike this one too.  Cons: - Your character usually move slow, through long paths with nothing happening. - For each character/story, you have at least 2 minutes holding down the 'W' key looking at the same ambient until you reach the destination. - Feels unpolished. Mouse leaving the game window. Footsteps being heard while flying. Ugly (low-res) font+shadow rendering. Dumb AI at the office. - Too much filler. Long stretches of nothing (just walking) or repetition (shoot the enemy too many times without any indication of progress; then it finally dies). Things seem to be there only to make the interaction longer, but not deeper.  This is an artsy game. It is meant to be looked at, it is meant to be thought-provoking.  However, I felt bored. I would have looked more at it, but there was nothing to look at. It made me think: 'Why am I wasting time doing this? This feels as boring as Dear Esther.'.  I'm sure there is some story the game is trying to tell, but there is too much time-wasting filler to between the small pieces of it.
